title: Very good app!
text:
Ive had it for two days now, not too long, but it has saved me a lot of time.  Used to be on apps for over 5+ hours but now on for around an hour because of the locks it provides.  I would love for a setting to not allow use of the app from this time to this time, but I haven’t figured out if its already there quite yet.  
Love the app and its already saved me a ton of time!  Id recommend it to anyone who needs a little extra help on getting off/saving time on your phone!

title: Amazing, just one bug
text:
I have been using for a day or two now, and I'm already noticing significant differences, between my computer, tablet, and phone! It's actually useful to stop me from spending forever to procrastinate something I need to do, it intervenes and I can actually consciously decide to get work done.

One bug though: When on Mac, there's a particular app (osu!) that doesn't immediately close, and when I quit the app it leaves behind an annoying block screen which SHOULD disappear, but when I click "Close" it doesn't go away. I have to use an extra open to get it to go away.

But other than that, this is a great app more people should use.

title: Works pretty good
text: For the most part this app functions as intended however, there are a couple of issues that I’ve run into, such as: I can’t differentiate limiting between the Facebook app and the Facebook messenger app. It actually just blocks messenger, even though I haven’t told it to. It also will not show me notifications anymore for limited apps, such as Instagram messages. I had to re-enable Amazon shopping because whenever I disabled it, it also disabled my Alexa app which I need to use on a regular basis. If those things are fixed, I’d give it a five star review but right now they limit how well this app works for me.

title: Incredibly effective
text: i went from like 2 hours of social media down to 30 i feel like a god

title: Life-changing app
text: I love this app and have recommended it to many people. I have a lot of work to do to break my screen addiction, and this app has been very helpful. It has a lot of useful tips to do a digital declutter, and used alongside Screen Time, it’s made a real difference in the way I use technology. Developers, thank you for what you do!

title: Premium screen reduction app
text: This app has been amazing for spending less time doom scrolling and getting sucked into wasting time. Also, the 🌽 block is much appreciated.

title: Great app to curb screen time!
text: With lots of ways to customize, ScreenZen can help you spend less time on unproductive apps. It helped me save an hour/day!

userName: Couldnt figure out a nIck nAme
title: Best Screen control app I’ve found
text: Does a great job and has so many options to tailor to what you need. I’ve cut myself down from 8 hours a day to just 30 minutes.

title: Just what I needed!
text: This app is so user friendly and truly helps me decrease my screen time. I can adjust easily where I want to focus on. Helps create healthy habits!

title: Options
text: I like the customization that makes opening distracting apps less rewarding.

title: This is giving me my life back
text:
This app is genius, it should be widely spread more often. This could kill the constant phone addictions everyone has, it’s an amazing thing. It’s so easy to waste life’s precious moments for something unimportant like scrolling. 
I really enjoy the message asking why are we checking the app before we can go in. It’s really refreshing and brings back thought into the things we sometimes do subconsciously.

title: Some glitches but SUPER helpful
text: This app has helped me cut down on my screen time significantly. I used to have 10+ hours of screen time everyday. Now I have around 3-4. I started with 5 opens a day, with 10 mins each, and I have reduced it to 2, 10 minute opens per day on my problem apps. I love how you can customize each app/app group. There are glitches here and there, but I’ve noticed them diminishing, so the developers must be fixing them :). The streaks really keep me in check. Thank you so much for a great app! And it’s free!

title: Moves the decision from unconscious to conscious
text:
This is actually an incredibly helpful app! I have it set up so that it gives me a pause and breathing exercise when I want to open a distracting app. That really moves the decision from my unconscious (“tap Instagram without thinking”) to my conscious brain. I’m not really motivated externally, I’m very internally motivated, so this was honestly the best and most helpful feature!

The locked screen also has the number of times I’ve opened the app, so I can keep track of my screentime in a much more active way, rather than the more reactive “check screentime in settings and be annoyed about it”.

I can honestly say I’ve forgotten to check Instagram reels now. It took months but I went from 1 hour per day to like, nothing. Although to be fair, that might just be because I’m way busier now, and reels is getting worse (somehow).

Thanks for creating such an incredible app!

title: Great app
text: Amazing app. Would be perfect 5 stars if you could strict lock apps for a certain time period during the day i.e. from 7:00-4:00.

title: Awesome
text: No ads, lots of customization, and it’s super helpful to minimize screen time

title: Great app!
text: Excellent app! Works great and has a straight forward interface. Thank you for all the time you’ve helped keep me from wasting! I’d recommend to anyone who wants to limit their screen time. I enjoy this app for its ability to restrict websites on any browser I choose and set a schedule so I can only access them during my scheduled ‘unproductive’ time.

title: I love this app. Life saver
text: Highly recommend this app. It’s amazing and I’m so grateful for it

title: Good app
text: Only thing I would change is if you could block a website

title: It actually helps
text: I love this app so much. I’ve tried so many things to help me maintain a healthy use of my apps and this is the only one that’s actually stuck. It’s nice that you can customize groups (like social media, work, whatever) and have the settings be unique for each. It’s really easy to use, too. 100% recommend.

title: GET IT
text: There’s no reason why you shouldn’t get it, first of all it’s FREE so there’s no harm in just downloading the app. Also, it’s truly one of the best screen time apps I’ve used, even compared to the paid ones, there are sooooo many features to help you stop spending so much time on apps that you didn’t want/need to spend time on. It’s seriously helped me so much you have to get it <3

title: Super awesome
text: Definitely worth it. Works super well to restrict yourself and screen time. Few small issues with apps opening and closing for no reason when locking, and small other things I’d prefer other ways, but it’s free so 100% recommend

title: Better then anything I’ve used
text: I’ve used opel and apple screen time. They both kinda worked but ScreenZen is the only thing that has ACTUALLY worked for me. It has managed to cut my screen time from 4h to roughly 2h. If you’re brain is rotten like mine and you want to fix it I would recommend it

title: Great App
text: Finally an app blocker that just wants to help people and not take money.

title: Helped Significantly
text: I love the feature of being able to have the app locked at all times and only opening it certain times a day for a designated amount of time. Helped me reduce my instagram usage from hours to 30 minutes or typically less.

title: best screen time blocker
text: i’ve never had an app that makes it so hard to go apps. i also love that you can pick everything, so you can make it easy or hard. my screen time has already reduced so much!

title: One day in & I’ve already saved hours.
text: Easy to set up, and it works.

title: Suggestion
text: The app is very easy to set up, and it’s its simplicity that gets the job done. The app further includes a count of the number of days users achieve our goal of limiting screen time, but this streak can be gone due to accidentally clicking on the unlock option of an app, even when it was cancelled immediately, and the screen time usage never exceeded the target. This could create a lot of frustration for users. Changing the way the app determines our streak could help improve user experience.

title: Amazing app
text: So much customization- can work with iPhone shortcuts etc. Best app like this that I have tried

text: It bring my screen time down from six hours to two hours

title: It screwed Safari.
text: I had the app for roughly a year now, and I had it blocking YouTube on Safari, and then one day, it blocked all of safari. Wouldn’t even let me unlock it. I hit unlock, I went to ScreenZen and disabled all blocking. All that showed up when I search anything on Safari was the ScreenZen Lock Screen. I even deleted the app and Safari is still screwed.

title: Could have probably used more time in Beta
text: I was willing to forgive the buggy nature of this app as it is fairly new and the developers seem responsive to feedback. However, I went to “Report a Bug” and despite multiple attempts it would not correctly submit the bug report. There are many features I like about this app but they don’t work consistently, and I cannot submit feedback about those issues.

title: The best app!
text: Has changed how I use my phone for the better. Knowing that I only have a small number of chances to open the app decreases the chance I’ll open it all. It’s made me realize that I barely ever WANT to look at the apps, it was just muscle memory to open them.

text: I’m only about a week in. I have been adjusting my settings because I’m noticing short stints of useless screen time. I’m still navigating the right settings for different apps but so far screen zen is definitely making me think twice before I unlock an app and scroll.

text: Awesome App!!!!

text: It’s easy enough to use and has helped keep me off my phone.

title: Only screen time that's worked for me
text: i still get caught doom scrolling sometimes, but the idea of having a limited number of "opens" has helped so much! a limited number of short sessions is so much more tangible for me than a looming "time limit" that my time-blindness can't quite fathom. also love how customizable it is! 10/10 highly recommend

title: So amazing!
text: This has drastically cut down on my time on my phone and I think about it so much less. I go hours without picking up my phone

title: really great app but daily screen time is confusing
text: i love this app so much! it’s helped me use less social media and take breaks between using a single app. my only issue is the daily screen time report… as of today, i have apparently already been on my phone for 8.75 hrs. i blocked youtube, spotify, safari and my alarm app from being counted since i go to sleep with my alarm app open and at least one of those other apps playing some kind of audio, and set my days to start at 12am. the screen time page also says i only have less than one hour each of my three most used apps since 12am… but im at 8 hrs and 45 minutes? maybe im missing something but im very confused.

title: Genuine life saver
text: helped me reduce screen time by a lot!

title: Love the concept, app problems though!
text: Super SUPER buggy interface even after I reinstalled !

title: Perfect app, one problem.
text:
This is hands down the most effective tool to combat screen addiction, so look no further.

These are gripes with the application itself:

With the tip customization, I would like the chosen image to replace the background ui instead of the logo. I can’t really see my picture!

Why is it eating up my battery at night? My phone is relatively new and I wonder what sort of refresh tasks are necessary 24/7 to keep it working. If there is some sort of background refresh that isn’t necessary a disable option would be nice. 

Still 5 stars because it is the most effective on the market and the tipping structure is nice!

title: Very good
text: Stoped my online gambling addiction -thanks screenzen

title: Love this app, here’s why
text: The app encourages you to get off screens by adding the option of adding offline activities. This reminds you not to be on the desired app. Also, the app has a streak. Once you have a big streak, you won’t want to lose it. To add, I love that you can set a desired amount of times that you can open the app. I have mine set to 5. The adjustable amount of time that you can keep the app open for is really helpful. Overall, if you are still indecisive, just get it. It is totally worth it.

title: Best Screen Management App
text: It’s Controls my Screen time on my phone Which I struggle with I Love this App

title: Great app, when it works.
text:
A very effective time-management app, but the “unlocking” of apps is very hit or miss. I will unlock an app with a limited number of unlocks, it will see that I’ve used ‘x + 1’ number of unlocks, but it won’t actually unlock the app.

When this happens, the only way to unlock the app and reset this behavior is to disable all blocking for the app inside ScreenZen, but this totally defeats the purpose of the app.

title: It works
text: gotta say this is the first time this kind of app that really stuck and really works. my weekly screen time has gone down more than 60%.

title: A bug
text: I changed the lockscreen option on the app from a math problem to password entering and now it won’t block Instagram after 5 minutes, that I’m supposed to use  it for. Also, the bug reporting option doesn’t work. But when the app is behaving correctly, it’s my favorite app!

title: The best screen time app out there.
text: This app has so many features, and its so reliable. You won’t find any other free screen time blocker like this one. I hope it doesn’t become a paid app, but if it does I might just get it.

title: Temporary Issue With Saving Preferences
text: A solid app for the most part.  A recent update somehow reset my preferences though. It made it so 1) the hard limits you set on apps are now soft limits, and if you go over the soft limits, they just increase the soft limits the next day (?!) and 2) even after you've run out of time, you can now just press the "ok" button on the screentime dialog and keep using the app.  I was able to change these preferences, but I locked my settings, so I had to wait through the timer before I could change them back.

title: excellent
text: Helps me not procrastinate. More productive than ever.

title: So thankful for this app
text: Thank you so much for creating this app and making it accessible. I started out using the free app (which comes with ALL the features) and only switched to unlocking lifetime access after using it for many months. This app is so important in today’s world and it forces me to be intentional about when I’m opening certain apps. It has helped me reduce my screen time and doomscrolling IMMENSELY and I am so thankful for it being free, ad free, and easy to use. I was happy to pay for it once I could and am thankful it’s not a monthly subscription and just a one time tip. Please keep doing the work you’re doing, it’s helping people so much more than you know!

title: Best one I’ve ever used
text: For some reason this app actually works for me. Those other ones allow me to easily bypass the settings and I’m doom scrolling all day. Not this one. Plus it’s free. Thank you for creating this and keeping it free

title: Has helped me curb my addiction
text: Needed something to get me away from doom scrolling. This app works perfect, is simple, and free. Couldn’t be better.

title: Better than basic Iphone restrictions
text: So much better at limiting app use, trying to keep the streak and planing out my limited usage makes this good habit way more fun.

title: It's been fantastic for my screen time
text: Plenty of options to choose from. Has helped me tons- definitely download and leave a tip if you can.

title: Best screen control app i've seen so far
text:
This app is simple and effective. No distracting features or analytics, it just does a great job helping me stay mindful of my time on my phone. Making you wait awhile before it will allow you to unlock the app is game changing for me, and I appreciate that you can customize the wait time.

At the moment this app is still free, and you can guarantee full access (in the event that they move to a subscription model) by "tipping". If this app moves to be paid, I hope it will continue to work in this way with a one-time purchase instead of following a subscription model.

title: Mindful screen time limits
text: Love that this app provides an opportunity to mindfully limit screen time. Lots of customizable options and streaks for a little fun!

title: So helpful for ADHD brain
text: The app is near perfect. I love that you can set the amount of time before the app is unlocked and that it’s kind of gamified with the number of unlocks per day. My only complaint is: there are a bunch of apps in the selection area that are no longer on my phone.

title: It works
text: It kept me off my social media while I was taking a break!!! The messages of just breathe and is it important really helped me stay focused on what I was trying to accomplish with the break!

title: great; not w/out its flaws
text: five stars as it’s the best screen time app just for the idea of it itself and its customizability; however it does have bugs like not being able to open an app at times. it’s been scary effective for me with apps, but could use some work on its blocking of websites as the bugs occur there, and are obviously then most noticeable on desktop

title: Really help
text: exactly what I’ve been looking for to help me manage my time and get off apps at night. It gives me time I need to actually choose.

title: Does its job so well
text: Really helpful app, it has very significantly reduced my use of social media. The app groups are useful, and it’s nice that you can decide how long each app cat get used for and how long you have to wait to open it.

title: exactly what i was looking for
text: after trying all of the apps out there, this is THE one. all of the others have ads, ask for money, and allow me to open the apps pretty easily. but the simpleness of this app has actually helped me spend less than 40 minutes a day on instagram! my screen time is down significantly and i am on track to reach my goal of completely deleting social media thanks to this specific app.

title: Amazing
text: This app has done wonders for me. Got to say mostly goodbye to scrolling on social media. Highly recommend for anyone who realizes they are addicted to social media (like I was).

title: Absolutely the BEST app on the App Store
text:
I usually don’t leave reviews but I had to for this app. It has all the best features that you need to actually stop you from accessing the apps and websites that you waste your time on. Since using this app I’ve saved HOURS in mere days. 

All features are free. It’s super simple to use. Very satisfying to see the tracked reasons why you used the app. It’s well thought out. I can’t believe it took me so long to find it.

Kudos to the developer!

title: 94 day streak and going!
text: this app actually works!!!! if you needed a sign to download it, this is it! my favorite feature is the customizable messages that pop up as part of the screen time lock, i have different ones based on different apps that say “are you doing this instead of working?” or “you’ve earned this!” and it’s really useful. i have a 94 day streak and my screen time is the lowest it’s ever been, i’m thrilled with this app!

title: flexible, utilitarian, effective
text:
i like how this app by default just makes it annoying to open the distracting apps. it makes me more likely to keep the limits on all the time instead of disabling them “just this once”, like i normally do.

this has a lot of thought put into it by the developers and i appreciate it. every notification i get is something i care about. there are a surprising number of options but the app is easy to use without having to use anything complicated.

title: screen zen is the best app in the world actually
text: i tell people about it all the time, which is why i’m telling you about it now

title: Great app but has gotten buggy
text: I’ve been using this app for about a year and a half and it has seriously improved my life. I like it enough to have “sent a tip” (donation) to the developers. Unfortunately in the past few months it’s gotten really buggy and the “report a bug” feature doesn’t actually work so I am posting here. Some apps have been displaying different open goals than I set in the ScreenZen app. The ScreenZen app still shows the right one but the unlock screen on the apps show a higher goal. Sometimes I get notifications that my daily open goal has been increased because the previous day I exceeded my goal, but I DO NOT want to goal to increase, I just had an unusual day where I had to use my phone a lot. I am going to uninstall and reinstall the app but I hope these bugs get fixed.

title: Very helpful
text: Still requires self discipline, but the breaks give you enough time and an impulse to think about how I’m doing with screen time.

title: Amazing!
text: This app is so usefully it genuinely helps my life so much. It’s free of cost and allows many apps

title: 3 days in-SUPER GOOD
text:
Honestly, I don’t give reviews, but this app actually helps. I deleted tiktok after the TikTok ban meaning I was stuck with IG and twitter, but I never stayed long on them but I did constantly go on them to see nothing new. When I got TikTok the algorithm was so good I stayed on there all day until the next day at 3AM. 

I didn’t like that because without it I was still productive, but being able to wait a few seconds before going on the app delaying the gratification and only having a limited amount of times with limited time I wasn’t even in the apps long and my productivity increased. So now if I don’t use the apps to increase knowledge or post my own content I’m off. I’ll scroll a few times but it’s not needed. 

Great app, keep up the good work guys.

title: Everything you want
text: Amazing app. Lots of options and detailed controls for apps and websites. You can set things anywhere from a reminder to consider when you open an app to having it hardcore blocked, settings locked. It’ll suit whatever you’re after with a screen time control app. No annoying banner ads. I donated after about 10 minutes of use bc I was so impressed. Can’t recommend highly enough

title: This has been incredibly helpful!
text: I would notice whole days would pass and i wouldnt even realize that it would disappear behind my phone screen. This app really teaches me to cherish my time while im on social media… and the time that i do spend on it, i now see as a treat. Most of the time i think about how productive im being on the app when i use to just mindlessly scroll. LIFE CHANGING!!!

title: BEST SCREEN TIME APP OUT
text:
First of all… free. Everything about this app is amazing, ive chosen the option to take 90 seconds to deep breathe before accessing social media vs ignoring the screen time limit for 5 minutes!
Also has game options to do instead of scrolling on social media! I love this app, better than all the other apps, trust me ive tried them out. And this one doesn’t have adds, doesn’t block you from accessing different aspects through a pay wall! What a great app! I’m glad I found it and use it! Its seriously helped me with my screen habits/addictions

title: Affordable and helpful
text: I appreciate an affordable app that gives me the tools to pursue better habits. It helps me to be more mindful about why I am picking up my phone and if there’s something better I can do with that time. Thank you for making this available.

title: Love this
text: I love this, so easy to use and understand, gives you a one hour break from the app itself in case you want to bed rot, helped me discipline myself with my phone and unnecessary screen time during finals. I passed my finals with a 100, as a total phone addict this helped a lot! It also has messages if you want to use an app in which you can choose, and the 5 second timer before opening the app really gives you clarity if you really need to open it. 10/10!

title: The best screen time limiter
text: It fully blocks apps after hitting the daily limit with no way to access them until the next day. This is helping me a lot with getting off my phone and I have no doubt it will help others too. At the time of writing this, the only purchases are optional tips which also give lifetime access if they switch to a paid model. I have nothing but respect to any developers who create apps without the idea of profit in mind and only want to cover the apps cost. Also have a good day <3

title: BETTER THAN OPAL

title: Helped me get back on track, low-key life changing
text: I’ve had a really bad addiction to instagram reels and other forms of short for content where I open up an app to check some messages or look for a tutorial and I get locked into a 3 hour loop of videos — it’s horrible. With ScreenZen, I’ve shortened my avg screen time from 6-8 hours to around 3, and I’ve felt the difference. It’s so helpful to have a constant reminder when opening an app that I really don’t want to be stuck on my phone for hours when I could be doing something better with my life… big fan, thank you ScreenZen developers!!
It’s great for lowering your screen time and I love that you can personalize it to your needs and limits

title: LOVE THIS APP but glitching rn?
text: I've been using this app for years to control my screen time and it's been an absolute help! However recently it's been doing this weird thing where whenever I open ScreenZen it says it is disabled for 20 seconds... I have to wait for the countdown to end before I can use the ScreenZen app? There is no way to turn this off :'/

title: It works!
text: Well!

title: Very well thought out
text: This app is very helpful and has a lot of options that I wish Apple screen time had. The only addition would be having a time limit applied to an entire category, such only 30 minutes of time can be used collectively for as all games.

title: Pretty ok. Could be better
text:
So first off, I used SZ to overcome social media addiction!!

I’m now at almost 600 days of checking social media<3x daily and no longer than 20 minutes per day!

I often go multiple days or weeks without using social!!

Now here’s the rub…

I’m a data freak & streak junkie! (Alcohol free for 1,377 days also!)

I perform endurance races both on foot and indoor rowing. 

My races are anywhere from 12-24hours. 

And I track EVERYTHING!

My breathing patterns, my macros, my calories, my sleep, my breathing patterns, HRV, BP, EVERYTHING!

UNFORTUNATELY, Screen Zen mucked up the streak counter. 

Like I said I’m almost 600 days with Screen Zen and every time I open a locked app it says “STREAK COUNT 1 DAYS”

And even though there’s a setting ‘switch’ button that is supposed to turn off streak counting, it doesn’t work. 

I’ve tried uninstalling & reinstalling the app a few dozen times with no success. 

In summary,
The app is helpful
But if you’ve got an addictive personality or need to reference your streak often for success, this app will simply increase your anxiety by repeating a single day streak count over and over and over and over and….

title: Much better than Apple Screen Time
text: This app has really cut down on my social media time without feeling like I’m being deprived. Most of the time I don’t even notice. GREAT set up. Lots of options to make it work with your life.

title: Apps never blocking
